intro: Discocalyx listeri, commonly known as the mountain thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves and produces fruiting heads that are surrounded by bracts. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments. Discocalyx listeri is a hardy perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
